title: Implement patchy apply command
description:
The apply command exists but is a stub that only prints 'applying..'. It needs to actually:
- Copy new files from patches/ to repo_dir
- Apply .diff files to existing files in repo_dir
- Handle errors gracefully (missing files, failed patches)
- Respect --dry-run flag (already shows message, but should list what would be done)

title: Implement patchy generate command
description:
The generate command exists but is a stub that only prints 'Generating patches...'. It needs to actually:
- Detect dirty changes in repo_dir (new files, modified files)
- Generate .diff files for modified files
- Copy new files to patches/ directory
- Mirror the repo_dir directory structure in patches/
- Respect --dry-run flag (already shows message, but should list what would be generated)

title: Implement patchy repo reset command
description:
The 'patchy repo reset' command is documented in README but does not exist. It should:
- Hard reset the Git working tree of repo_dir
- Discard all local changes (git reset --hard)
- Accept --repo-dir flag
- Show appropriate confirmation/output

Needs: new command structure in src/commands/repo/

title: Implement patchy repo checkout command
description:
The 'patchy repo checkout --ref <git-ref>' command is documented in README but does not exist. It should:
- Check out a specific Git ref (branch, tag, or SHA) in repo_dir
- Accept --ref flag (required)
- Accept --repo-dir flag
- Handle errors (invalid ref, dirty working tree)

Needs: new command structure in src/commands/repo/

title: Implement patchy repo clone command
description:
The 'patchy repo clone --url <git-url>' command is documented in README but does not exist. It should:
- Clone a repository into a subdirectory of repo_base_dir
- Derive target directory name from repo URL
- Accept --repo-base-dir flag
- Accept --ref flag to checkout specific ref after clone
- Accept --repo-url flag
- Handle errors (invalid URL, directory exists)

Needs: new command structure in src/commands/repo/

title: Implement environment variable support
description:
README documents environment variables but they are NOT implemented. The config resolver only handles CLI flags and JSON config.

Required env vars to support:
- PATCHY_REPO_DIR
- PATCHY_REPO_BASE_DIR
- PATCHY_PATCHES_DIR
- PATCHY_CONFIG
- PATCHY_VERBOSE
- PATCHY_DRY_RUN
- PATCHY_REPO_URL
- PATCHY_REF

Implementation needs:
1. Update config resolver (src/config/resolver.ts) to read process.env
2. Maintain precedence: CLI flags > env vars > config file > defaults
3. Update CLI --help output to mention corresponding env var for each flag (modern CLI best practice)
4. Example help format: '--repo-dir <path>  Path to repo [env: PATCHY_REPO_DIR]'

Location: src/config/resolver.ts

title: Allow configuring fuzzFactor for patch application
description:
Currently fuzzFactor is hardcoded to 2 in apply-diff.ts. Allow users to configure this via:
- CLI flag: --fuzz-factor
- Config: fuzz_factor in patchy.json
- Env var: PATCHY_FUZZ_FACTOR

Higher values allow patches to apply even when context lines have shifted, but may cause incorrect applications. Default should remain 2.
